name: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Dissociative Episodes (PNDE)
chief_complaint: I wake up screaming and don't recognize my own family, but I don't remember it happening

lab_results.EEG during episode: Diffuse theta waves without seizure patterns

treatment: Emergency lorazepam protocol for prolonged episodes
prognosis: Variable; 40% achieve remission with treatment, 30% have chronic recurrent episodes, remainder show gradual improvement over years
description: A rare dissociative sleep disorder where patients experience terrifying nocturnal episodes with complete lack of recognition of familiar people/environments, distinct from night terrors or REM behavior disorder by the presence of waking dissociative features and absence of sleepwalking. Episodes typically last 5-20 minutes with complete amnesia afterward.
